description: I went last night to try this place out! Tables were constantly filled but people were in and out within 30 min. We got the beef noodle soup and the beef was so tender! The noodles were soft and yummy! The pig ears were so good (wish they gave more in a bowl). The homemade dumplings were amazing! You get 14 for $8.99! 4 stars because they don't serve alcohol and they only had 1 server for the place at the time.
author: Tara A.

description: It's ok.  I don't agree with the posts raving about this place since I eat dumplings quite a bit.  Everyone should also keep in mind that if you order dumplings and noodles you will get your noodles and apps quite a bit before the dumplings.  The dumplings are made to order so it takes longer.  I saw people starting to get irritated about the wait but they should expect it if you are dealing with made to order vs. frozen.  The food is just ok and the appetizer plates fall into the same category.  Nothing here wow'd me so I'll move on to the next.
author: Amorette K.

description: Found this place via Yelp listed as hot & new! Since my husband loves dumplings we decided to take a chance and we're pleasantly surprised! Came in early afternoon on a Saturday and waited about 5-10mins. Ordered the green pepper & fish dumpling soup - light, refreshing and delicious!! Steamed pork and three delicacies - well seasoned and great textured dumpling skin. My least favorite was the celery and pork - still good, but celery flavor was a bit overwhelming. Usually, I hate ordering dumpling since it tastes like soggy dough, but this place was great!! Good quality homemade dumplings that are well seasoned with good meat/dumpling skin ratio. Only cons- they were out of some of the flavors by time we got there and for some reason they couldn't do pan fried versions that day. Looking forward to another visit soon!!
author: Suzie J.

description: bad experience would never come back again...first of all small place like this take way to long to take orders and take forever to get our orders. the bus boy gave our order to someone just ordered and we have been waited for over 15 mins...the worst part is last order we got had a hair on a dumpling, how disgusting can it be
author: Nina Y.

description: I came here a while back when it was first opening. We didn't get great service and the food was not the best. I understand that it was a grand opening, but they only had 2 dumplings available on their entire menu. Also, they didn't even have drinks for us. I don't understand how a restaurant can open without having everything ready. when we did get our food, it wasn't even that good. Unfortunately I won't be returning to this dumpling house anytime soon.
author: Alexander C.

description: Love how that this tiny dumpling store keeps it simple.  When a restaurant keeps a small but focus menu with signature items, you know they will be able to produce quality products!  The dumplings are made fresh to order! The mushroom and fish dumplings are unique in flavor.  Three meet dumplings are also delicious.  Will definitely come back for soupy dumplings on a cold hot day.  Down side is that that this place is not meant for groups or a long sit down dinner.  Best for 2-4 people parties.
author: Debbie C.

description: Yay for new places opening up in the sunset!  This place is a basically a modern day dumpling place, it is very similar Din Tai Fung since you can see the chefs actually wrap the dumplings right in front of you.  It is a very simple menu and the place is pretty small so make sure to get there early to avoid the rush.  The dumplings were really fresh and had good flavor.  They were decently priced for what it is (with the somewhat nice place and view of the chefs), but the appetizers were really good!  I had some friends who visited Taiwan and they said, this place was pretty good.  I recommend the seaweed salad and cucumber salad.
author: Jacky S.

description: Only a few menu options but all that we tried were  excellent.  Fresh, plentiful dumplings. Just awesome
author: Russ G.

description:
The place is so new that it is very very slow. All the dumplings are handmade as you order and literally one person rolling the skin and the other wrapping the dumplings.  They don't really make your order in the order of who ordered what, when. They have one plate of one ingredient, they will finish wrapping that plate then move to another ingredient. Meaning if you order chicken dumpling and shrimp dumpling at the same table and they are busy, you will get one then wait a long time for the other. 

The flavors of the ingredients are fresh. The meat ones are good and have meat, BUT if you order the shrimp, say shrimp ad 3 fresh ingredients, you will get very very little shrimp. Not worth it. If you order the dumpling in soup, it is really just water. So not really sure why to order that. 

The sides are just ok. Can get better everywhere.

People seem nice and authentic flavors. Good to try.
author: Food Is L.

description: Very good dumplings. They make them right there.  A filling dinner for 2 only $21. Very clean shop. Our server was very friendly and prompt. The dumplings and chili sauce were delicious. RECOMMEND !
author: James P.

description: Dumplings were very fresh. Dumpling skins were excellent. Fillings were pretty good but we got one too salty batch. Cucumbers and tofu skin side dishes were seasoned well and tasty. I really like that they have a large selection of dumplings without pork since I don't eat pork. I do wish they would have one vegetarian option - that is the best feature of Dumpling Empire in South San Francisco and it's pretty rare to find good vegetarian dumplings around here. I like that they have soup, regular, and fried versions of each dumpling. The soup version is especially tasty on a cold day. Overall, seems slightly more expensive than other no frills Chinese places like House of Pancake, but still cheap overall and definitely worth visiting especially since I haven't seen any other dumpling shop in the city with such fresh dumplings.
author: Erin C.

description: This is a pretty good, simple dim sum place. Each option can be steamed, made into a soup or pan fried (which unfortunately wasn't an option during the soft opening). Pigs ears were tasty but the soup was like water. I guess I'm used to awesome nourishing broth and this was just not that. It's also really cool to see the ladies making dumplings, which my toddler loved as well.
author: Ashley F.

description: Omg fresh dumplings and there's a window to see them make the fresh dumplings 5star!!
author: Victor J.

description: This place is legit! Fresh tasty dumplings. You can watch the ladies making them from your table. Small menu with their specialties made from fresh ingredients. Highly recommend
author: Jen R.

description: Damn good dumplings. Just moved in down the street and will be coming here a lot. The shrimp and 3 delicacies dumpling and tofu skin salad are super dank.
author: Will J.

description: I've been here twice now and the first time was a super positive experience. The female server was working and was pleasant. Let me preface this review by saying the food here is delicious. The beef noodle soup is to die for, and the dumplings are delicious and made fresh right in front of you. Now on to my bad rating. My second time in here, we sat for 20ish minutes while there were 4 tables of people in the restaurant waiting for our server to take our order. We watched two separate families get seated and served within 2 minutes of sitting down. We weren't on our phones and our menus were neatly folded in the middle of the table. I even tried to make eye contact with the gentleman taking orders multiple times to which we were ignored. I can't help but feel that because we were not of Asian descent, that the gentleman did not want to serve us. We finally decided to get up and leave and go to our favorite Pho place right down the road. I am not the type to write bad reviews and I myself have worked in the customer service industry for close to 15 years now. I know when I'm not welcome, and this place is certainly not accommodating to outsiders. Your mileage may vary. As a note this was at 8:47 pm on a Saturday. We didn't walk in at 9:55.
author: Hunter F.

description:
the dumplings were spot on....delicious....good quantity and value.   5 stars

as for the house special beef noodle soup.  we've ordered it twice and each time it had like four ..maybe six SMALL slices of beef.   it'd be fine if this menu item was 6.95 but it's 10.95.    they really need to better here bc this item is just a rip off.    minus one star.

if you stick to the dumplings, you wont be disappointed!
author: william f.

description: This place is clean and cheap. There aren't many options on the menu but all of them taste good. And one thing i liked the most was their homemade chili sauce!!
author: Ginzu G.

description: Delicious and welcome addition to the Sunset! The dumplings are freshly made before your eyes. We had the shiitake mushroom & fish dumplings in a soup, and the shrimp & zucchini on the plate. As mentioned in another review, the soup broth is rather bland. There is also not a lot of vegetarian options. But the portions are generous- 10 dumplings in the soup and 14 on the plate. They did not have the pan-fried option available yet, but I will definitely return to try that as well.
author: Arielle T.
